sense.gloss: adds strength or emphasis to verbs
snow shoveling (shovelling), snow clearing, snow removal
snow shovel, snow plow, snow plough
shaved ice (usually served with flavored simple syrup), Italian ice, snow cone, sno-cone
to snatch (and run), to carry off, to swipe, to nab
to scoop up (and remove; sand, earth, etc.)
to struggle, to writhe, to wriggle, to squirm
to act frantically, to make desperate efforts
being frustrated because something is not quite as hoped (just as one cannot scratch an itch from outside a shoe), having an itch that one cannot scratch

sdata.j: ↑窮地↑↓きゅうち↓から↑足掻↑↓あが↓き↑出↑↓で↓る。
sdata.e: He will wriggle out of the fix.

sdata.j: もっと↑単刀直入↑↓たんとうちょくにゅう↓に↑言↑↓い↓ってくれないかな。↑隔靴掻痒↑↓かっかそうよう↓の↑感↑↓かん↓なきにしもあらずだよ。
sdata.e: You don't have to leave me hanging like this. Why don't you just come out and tell it to me straight?

sdata.j: トムが↑授業↑↓じゅぎょう↓↑中↑↓ちゅう↓にいびきを↑掻↑↓か↓いているのが↑聞↑↓き↓こえました。
sdata.e: I heard Tom snoring during the class.

sdata.j: その↑社会↑↓しゃかい↓↑学者↑↓がくしゃ↓は↑背中↑↓せなか↓を↑掻↑↓か↓く↑癖↑↓くせ↓がある。
sdata.e: The sociologist has a habit of scratching his back.

sdata.j: ↑借金↑↓しゃっきん↓で↑足掻↑↓あが↓きがとれない。
sdata.e: He is up to his ears in debt.

sdata.j: ↑虫↑↓むし↓に↑噛↑↓か↓まれたところを↑掻↑↓か↓いてはいけない。
sdata.e: You should try not to scratch your insect bites.

sdata.j: ↑猫↑↓ねこ↓は↑私↑↓わたし↓の↑手↑↓て↓を↑引↑↓ひ↓っ↑掻↑↓か↓いた。
↑彼↑↓かれ↓の↑絶↑↓た↓え↑間↑↓ま↓ない↑侮辱↑↓ぶじょく↓が↑彼女↑↓かのじょ↓の↑怒↑↓いか↓りを↑掻↑↓か↓き↑立↑↓た↓てた。
sdata.e: His constant insults aroused her anger.

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓は↑人↑↓ひと↓ごみを↑掻↑↓か↓き↑分↑↓わ↓けて↑走↑↓はし↓ってくるのを↑彼女↑↓かのじょ↓はちらりと↑見↑↓み↓た。
sdata.e: She glimpsed him running through the crowd.

words.gloss: snow shoveling (shovelling), snow clearing, snow removal
shaved ice (usually served with flavored simple syrup), Italian ice, snow cone, sno-cone
